posts.metaTitle: Change Order Accounting: GAAP Compliance & P&L Impact Guide
posts.metaDescription: Master change order accounting with our guide to GAAP compliance, revenue recognition timing, percentage of completion accounting, and P&L impact management.
posts.summary: This post targets CFOs, Controllers, and Finance Directors who need to understand the accounting complexities of change orders. It covers critical GAAP compliance issues including ASC 606 revenue recognition for contract modifications, percentage of completion accounting adjustments, and timing differences that can materially impact financial statements. The article will explain WIP reporting challenges, earned value management, cost accrual timing, and proper documentation for audit trails. It addresses common pitfalls like premature revenue recognition, unrecorded liabilities, and margin erosion from unpriced change orders. The content includes practical examples of journal entries, disclosure requirements, and internal controls. A free downloadable checklist helps finance teams ensure proper change order accounting treatment and compliance with both GAAP and internal reporting requirements.
